walkthroughs.title: Getting Started with DevBuddy
walkthroughs.description: Learn how to use DevBuddy to manage your tickets from Linear, Jira, and more‚Äîdirectly from VS Code

steps.title: Welcome to DevBuddy! üëã
steps.description:
DevBuddy brings multi-platform ticket management into VS Code. You can view tickets, update statuses, create branches, and more‚Äîall without leaving your editor.

**Supported Platforms:**
‚Ä¢ ‚úÖ Linear (full features)
‚Ä¢ ‚úÖ Jira Cloud (core features)
‚Ä¢ ‚è≥ More coming soon!

Let's get started!

steps.title: Choose Your Platform
steps.description:
First, select which platform you use for ticket management.

[Open Settings](command:workbench.action.openSettings?%5B%22devBuddy.provider%22%5D)

Set `devBuddy.provider` to:
‚Ä¢ **"linear"** - For Linear users
‚Ä¢ **"jira"** - For Jira Cloud users

You can change this anytime!

steps.title: Connect Linear (Linear Users)
steps.description:
**If you chose Linear**, connect your workspace with an API key:

1. Get your API key: [linear.app/settings/api](https://linear.app/settings/api)
2. Run the setup command:

[Configure Linear API Key](command:devBuddy.configureLinearToken)

**Skip this step if you're using Jira.**

steps.title: Connect Jira Cloud (Jira Users)
steps.description:
**If you chose Jira**, connect your Jira Cloud workspace:

1. Run the setup wizard:

[Setup Jira Cloud](command:devBuddy.jira.setup)

2. The wizard will ask for:
   ‚Ä¢ **Any URL from your Jira** (e.g., paste a ticket URL like `https://mycompany.atlassian.net/browse/ENG-123`)
   ‚Ä¢ Your email address
   ‚Ä¢ An API token from [id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/security/api-tokens](https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/security/api-tokens)

**Just like Linear, you can paste any Jira ticket URL and DevBuddy will extract your site URL!**

**Skip this step if you're using Linear.**

steps.title: Explore Your Tickets
steps.description:
The **DevBuddy sidebar** shows all your assigned tickets/issues organized by status.

[Open DevBuddy Sidebar](command:workbench.view.extension.dev-buddy)

Click any ticket to see details, comments, and take actions like updating status or adding comments.

**Works with both Linear and Jira!**

media.altText: DevBuddy sidebar showing tickets organized by status with quick actions

steps.title: Update Ticket Status
steps.description:
Change ticket status without leaving VS Code:

‚Ä¢ Right-click any ticket/issue
‚Ä¢ Select **Update Status** or **Change Status**
‚Ä¢ Choose from your workflow states
‚Ä¢ See visual indicators for each status

**Works with both Linear and Jira!**

steps.title: Create New Tickets
steps.description:
Create tickets/issues directly from VS Code:

[Create New Ticket](command:devBuddy.createTicket)

**Linear:** Rich editor with all fields (team, project, labels, priority, estimates)

**Jira:** Create issues with project, type, priority, assignee, and more

**Works with both platforms!**

steps.title: Create Branches from Tickets (Linear)
steps.description:
**Linear users:** Start a branch directly from any ticket!

‚Ä¢ Click the branch icon next to any ticket
‚Ä¢ Choose your source branch
‚Ä¢ Review the auto-generated name
‚Ä¢ DevBuddy creates and checks out the branch

**Note:** Branch creation is currently Linear-only. Jira support coming soon!

media.altText: Linear sidebar showing ticket details with branch creation and management

steps.title: Convert TODOs to Tickets (Linear)
steps.description:
**Linear users:** Convert TODOs to tickets with automatic code permalinks!

**What you get:**
‚Ä¢ TODO ‚Üí Linear ticket in one click
‚Ä¢ Automatic GitHub/GitLab/Bitbucket permalink
‚Ä¢ Code context (5 lines before/after)
‚Ä¢ Branch and commit info

[Try Converting a TODO](command:devBuddy.convertTodoToTicket)

**Note:** Currently Linear-only. Jira support coming soon!

media.altText: Converting a TODO comment to a Linear ticket with automatic permalink generation

steps.title: Generate Standup Updates (Linear)
steps.description:
**Linear users:** Let AI generate your standup update from commits and Linear activity!

[Open Standup Builder](command:devBuddy.openStandupBuilder)

‚Ä¢ AI analyzes your commits and tickets
‚Ä¢ Generates a summary in your preferred tone
‚Ä¢ Copy and share with your team

**Note:** AI features currently Linear-only. Jira support coming soon!

media.altText: Standup Builder generating daily standup from commits and Linear tickets

steps.title: AI-Powered PR Summaries (Linear)
steps.description:
**Linear users:** Generate comprehensive PR summaries for your changes:

[Generate PR Summary](command:devBuddy.generatePRSummary)

‚Ä¢ Detects affected packages in monorepos
‚Ä¢ Analyzes git changes and commits
‚Ä¢ Links to Linear tickets
‚Ä¢ Customizable writing tone

**Note:** AI features currently Linear-only. Jira support coming soon!

media.altText: PR Summary generation with monorepo package detection and analysis

steps.title: Use the AI Chat Assistant
steps.description:
Talk to DevBuddy using the chat interface!

Open VS Code Chat and type `@devbuddy` to:

‚Ä¢ `/tickets` - See your current tickets
‚Ä¢ `/standup` - Generate standup update (Linear)
‚Ä¢ `/pr` - Generate PR summary (Linear)
‚Ä¢ `/status` - Update ticket status

Or just ask questions naturally!

**Works with both platforms, with enhanced features for Linear.**

steps.title: Jira-Specific Features
steps.description:
**Jira users** get these powerful features:

‚Ä¢ **JQL Search** - Search with Jira Query Language
‚Ä¢ **Workflow Transitions** - Full workflow support
‚Ä¢ **Sprints & Boards** - View and manage sprints
‚Ä¢ **Runtime Validation** - Production-grade API validation

**Coming soon:**
‚Ä¢ Branch integration
‚Ä¢ AI features
‚Ä¢ Webview panels
‚Ä¢ Custom fields UI

steps.title: Get Help Anytime
steps.description:
**Need help?** Click the **Help** button (question icon) at the top of the DevBuddy sidebar.

**Customize your experience:**
‚Ä¢ Open Settings (Cmd/Ctrl + ,)
‚Ä¢ Search for "DevBuddy"
‚Ä¢ Configure platform, AI model, writing tone, and more

[Open Settings](command:workbench.action.openSettings?%5B%22devBuddy%22%5D)

**Documentation:**
‚Ä¢ README.md - Main guide
‚Ä¢ FEATURE_COMPATIBILITY_MATRIX.md - Platform features
‚Ä¢ JIRA_QUICK_START.md - Jira setup

You're all set! üéâ

devBuddy.ai.disabled.markdownDescription:
**Completely disable AI features** and use rule-based summarization instead.

‚ö†Ô∏è **For sensitive organizations:** Enable this setting if you cannot use external AI services. The extension will use intelligent rule-based analysis instead.

**When to enable:**
- Working in a highly regulated environment
- Security policies prohibit external AI
- GitHub Copilot is not available

enumDescriptions: Automatically select the best available model
GitHub Copilot: GPT-4 Turbo (Fast and powerful)
devBuddy.ai.model.description: AI model to use for summarization. Uses VS Code's Language Model API (GitHub Copilot).

devBuddy.aiModel.description: ‚ö†Ô∏è Deprecated: Use 'devBuddy.ai.model' instead. This setting will be removed in a future version.

devBuddy.debugMode.markdownDescription:
**Enable debug logging** for troubleshooting.

‚úÖ **When enabled:**
- Shows detailed logs in the "DevBuddy" Output channel
- Automatically opens the Output panel
- Logs all API calls, AI operations, and git commands

üí° **Use this when:**
- Reporting bugs or issues
- Understanding what the extension is doing
- Debugging AI summarization
- Troubleshooting platform API issues (Linear, Jira)

devBuddy.telemetry.enabled.markdownDescription:
**Share anonymous usage data to help improve DevBuddy**

‚úÖ **Benefits:**
- Help us prioritize features
- Improve stability and performance
- Get 14 extra days of Pro trial!

üîí **Privacy:**
- 100% anonymous (no personal data)
- No code or file names tracked
- No content collection
- Easy opt-out anytime

üí° **What we collect:**
- Feature usage patterns
- Error types (not content)
- Performance metrics
- Extension version & platform

[Learn more about our telemetry](https://github.com/angelogirardi/developer-buddy#telemetry)
